page.title: 04RELIGION IN PORTNAHAVEN
page.content: Christianity arrived in this part of Islay in the year 563AD.when{Columban} monks under the leadership of {St. {Comman}founded a monastery in{ {Kilchoman.}Until the 1820's Portnahaven was part of the Parish of Kilchoman.In the 1820's a Parliamentary church was built to a design by{Thomas Telford.}This listed building still houses the current{ {Church of Scotland}congregation.In 1843 at the time of the{Disruption a {Free Church of Scotland}was built in the village.In 1900 the{Free Church} and the{United Presbyterian Church} united and a {United Free Church}was built which disappeared in the union with the Church of Scotland in 1929.The Free church however continues to this day although it has had no resident minister for a number of years.
